modules.description: This module sends HTTP/1.1 requests over a Unix file descriptor and handles responses using provided callbacks. It works with raw file descriptors, request and response handlers, and HTTP body writers. Use it to implement custom HTTP clients that manage their own connections and streaming request bodies.

Handles incoming network connections for HTTP/1.x servers. It dispatches requests to user-defined handlers, supports protocol upgrades, and manages errors per connection. This module is used to implement custom HTTP servers that process requests over Unix domain sockets or TCP/IP.

This module implements HTTP/1.x clients and servers using Unix file descriptors, enabling bidirectional communication over TCP/IP or Unix domain sockets. It provides data types for requests, responses, and streaming bodies, along with operations to send requests, handle incoming connections, and process headers and body data incrementally. You can use it to build custom HTTP clients that stream large payloads or implement servers that support protocol upgrades like WebSockets. Specific use cases include sending chunked HTTP requests with Lwt-driven I/O and handling server-side requests with per-connection error management.
